alert.note: Alert for Central and Southern Lewis and Clark; Eastern Glacier; Eastern Pondera; Eastern Teton; Northern Rocky Mountain Front; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 26 at 1:19PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...An intense snow shower will impact portions of Lewis and Clark, northwestern Pondera, central Glacier, Teton Counties through 200 PM MST... At 115 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking heavy snow showers along a line extending from near East Glacier Park to near Lincoln. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Visibility one-half mile or less due to falling and blowing snow. Expect rapidly changing road conditions. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Low visibility could result in dangerous driving conditions. Locations impacted include... Choteau, Lincoln, Browning, Fairfield, Heart Butte, Augusta, East Glacier Park Village, North Browning, Kiowa, Wolf Creek, South Browning, East Glacier Park, Dupuyer, Pishkun Reservoir, Saint Mary, Many Glacier, Nilan Reservoir, Bean Lake, Starr School and Bowmans Corner. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 206 and 243. Highway 200 between mile markers 66 and 121. Highway 89 between mile markers 1 and 39. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH

area.areaDesc: Central and Southern Lewis and Clark; Eastern Glacier; Eastern Pondera; Eastern Teton; Northern Rocky Mountain Front; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
